title: Drawing, "Sheet from a Sketchbook: Minerva Asking Jupiter for the Happiness of Ulysses or  Minerva Questions Jupiter on the Destiny of Ithaca", 1802–05
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, traces of graphite
markings: Indistinct watermark: two letters probably 'E' and 'C' flanking a motif
inscribed: Below image in pen and brown ink over black chalk: Minerva prega giove per la felicita' d' ulisse.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Minerva is shown kneeling before Jupiter who leans toward her and touches her chin.  Juno sits beside Jupiter.  Other gods are in the background at left.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Sheet from a Sketchbook: Minerva Asking Jupiter for the Happiness of Ulysses or  Minerva Questions Jupiter on the Destiny of Ithaca", 1802–05.
1802–05. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, traces of graphite. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3344.
